result.execSummary:
The defendant Kelly A. Hart was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. One or more other charges in this case were dismissed. The dismissed charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Kelly A. Hart is presumed innocent of the dismissed charges.

  • Kelly A. Hart was found guilty of Retail Theft - Intentionally Take (<=$500), a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.50(1m)(b).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

Review hearing on May 15, 2017 at 03:00 pm.

ADDRESS INFO for Kelly A. Hart

Prior: 621 N. Brown Street, Rhinelander, WI 54501
notified Rachel @ ONSO - warrant amount posted - given time to pay for balance
No appearance or payment of fine, court orders warrant

Defendant Kelly A. Hart in court with attorney Chad Lynch.  Michael William Schiek appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Schiek states agreement - Lynch concurs. State moves to dismiss Counts 2 and 3 - Granted. Plea questionnaire filed. Defenant enters no contest plea to Count 1.   Court reads on waiver of rights and tendering plea. Waiver free and voluntary. Court finds that a factual basis for the plea exists and finds defendant guilty. Schiek/Lynch/Court statement on sentencing. Victim Impact Statement filed. 
Court Sentence
WHS/POP - 12 months
CC/DNA Surcharge/Supervision Fees
  Fine/Forfeiture/Court Costs are not a condition of probation and are to be paid in full directly to the Clerk of Court's Office within 60 days or date provided by Court, unless a payment plan has been approved and set up through the Clerk of Court's Office.
DNA Sample
  The court informs defendant of right to request expungement of the DNA under Wis. Stat. 165.77(4).
AODA assessment and follow through
Restitution - $130.96 (includes 10%)
Any other conditions/counseling deemed appropriate by PO
Appeal rights given. Payment plan application given. 
Adj. 3:27 p.m.  Review hearing scheduled for January 23, 2017 at 03:00 pm.

Attorney Chad Lynch in court.  Michael William Schiek appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
2:27
Defendant contacted attorney   - had death in family - agreement was reached - Schiek does not object to adjournment -
Bail continued  Pre-trial conference scheduled for October 25, 2016 at 03:00 pm.

Schiek statement that resolution is close - Lynch resolution is close but requests adjournment for plea/sentencing. Bail continued. Adj. 11:41 am.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for August 23, 2016 at 02:30 pm.

Bail continued. Adj. 3:49 p.m.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for July 5, 2016 at 11:30 am.
States Reply to Discovery  and State's Demand for Discovery  - includes cover letter

In receipt of complaint, right to counsel - defendant will seek counsel,  Schiek statement to bail - Court sets $ sig bond.
